snippet: The new owners of the name and other assets of the long-closed music club say they want to find it a new home.
abstract: The new owners of the name and other assets of the long-closed music club say they want to find it a new home.
lead_paragraph: CBGB the club is five years gone now, having been replaced, in the way of all things Lower East Side, by a men's wear boutique. But CBGB the brand, the merchandising empire and the collection of gear and furnishings are still around. And now, The Local East Village reports, they have been sold by the family of the late Hilly Kristal to a group, as yet unidentified, whose spokesman says it plans to reopen the club elsewhere and "keep CBGB alive through loud music and by supporting new bands." Read more on The Local East Village »
